poem:
### In the Aisles of Perception

In the gleam of packaging,  
lies the taste of deception.  
Rich promises melt,  
on our unguarded tongues.  
A simple bar whispers,  
in the currency of truth,  
while gold-wrapped fancies  
sink in their own vanity.  
We savor what is simple,  
while marketing dreams  
turn bittersweet  
in the shadowed shelves.

That’s fine, I tell myself: I’m a free-thinking, rational, analytical mind who can tune out any biases or marketing. Well, that’s what I".
